intro: Parosela catatona, commonly known as the catatonic parosela, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a humid climate to flourish. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
